website_summaries.verdict: The 27-inch AOC Q2781PQ is a sleek-looking In-Plane Switching (IPS) monitor that offers accurate colors, solid grayscale performance, and a generous assortment of video inputs.

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect UK adaptor
customer_reviews.text: No UK plug. The monitor is nice, it's certainly slim, and with multiple HDMI inputs, is good value of money. Just be aware that the mains adaptors supplied does not fit UK plugs. There is a universal transformer, and as is usual with electronics, separate separate EU and UK plugs to fit it. Unfortunately, the UK 3-pin plug has the wrong adaptor to fit the transformer, so it's pretty useless. You'll either need to steal a correct adaptor from another device (in my case the kitchen radio), or use the EU plug in a shaver socket. See pics showing transformer, and the separate EU/UK plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for two months now and am thrilled with it. It provides accurate colours. My other monitor next to this one now looks washed out in comparison. I like the fact that it has HDMI and audio out. This makes it ideal for presentations whilst on the move. I just need to take a speaker/ set of speakers and can link my device up to the HDMI and am able to present anywhere to a few people on the large size screen. I am sure a setup with a Google Chromecast could turn it into a nice media streaming device.

customer_reviews.title: I'm a graphic designer and colour reproduction, response time ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic designer and colour reproduction, response time and contrast is important to me. I bought five different monitors before choosing this one. The one issue I have with it is that on bright backgrounds, you will see a horizontal scan line panning from top to bottom over and over again. This isn't an 'error', it's just how the monitor has been built. I chose to keep it anyway because it's subtle enough that only if you're looking for it will you find it. I'd consider buying this monitor again.
